tutorial.title: Building with the Box Model
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to style webpages with paddings and margins.

lessons.title: Box model
lessons.interactiveContent: Elements on a webpage are rectangular boxes with four layers: content, paddings, borders, and margins.

lessons.title: Using padding
lessons.interactiveContent: Paddings generate space between the content and the border of an element.

lessons.title: Padding - left
lessons.interactiveContent:
To change the padding on the left side of an element, we use the padding-left property.

Make sure to pick padding-left.

lessons.title: Padding - right
lessons.interactiveContent:
To change the padding on the right side of an element, we use the padding-right property.

Make sure to pick padding-right.

lessons.title: Padding - top and bottom
lessons.interactiveContent:
The same goes for padding-top and padding-bottom.

Make sure to pick padding, followed by padding.

executableContent.instructions:
Add left and right paddings to the existing `p` rule. Choose any number of pixels you want.

Feel free to asks for AI's help.

There's one property that changes the paddings on all four sides of an element at once. 

Can you use AI to figure out which property is that?

lessons.title: Padding
lessons.interactiveContent:
Change the paddings on all four sides of the p element by choosing the correct property.

Make sure to pick padding.

lessons.title: Question 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
What are paddings?

The space between the content and the border of an elementThe border of an element

The space between the content and the border of an element.

lessons.title: Question 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's the padding-left property for?

It adds space on the left side of an elementIt adds borders to an element

It adds space on the left side of an element.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent: Elements on a webpage can have borders around them, which wrap around the content and any padding.

lessons.title: Borders
lessons.interactiveContent:
To see how it looks, add the border property.

Make sure to pick border:, followed by solid;.

lessons.title: Border width
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can set the width of a border by adding a number in pixels right after solid.

Here, we can create a wider border by setting its width to 10px.

Make sure to pick 10px;.

lessons.title: Border color
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can make this border red by setting the color value to red.

Make sure to pick red;.

lessons.title: Border radius
lessons.interactiveContent:
border-radius is a property that rounds the corners of an element. If we set the radius to 20px, the border curves 20px before the corner.

Make sure to pick border-radius:, followed by 20px;.

lessons.title: Other elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
border-radius works on all elements, even links.

To round the corners of all links, add border-radius to the a rule.

Make sure to pick border-radius:, followed by 20px;.

lessons.title: Question 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's a border in CSS?

A line of a certain thickness and color around an elementThe element's background

A line of a certain thickness and color around an element.

lessons.title: Question 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
To make the border appear, which value is necessary?

The value solid is necessaryThe value 10px red is necessary

The value solid is necessary.

lessons.title: Question 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
How do we round the corners of an element?

With the border-radius propertyWith the text-align property

With the border-radius property.

lessons.title: Question 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
How do we set the color of a border?

By adding a color value to the border propertyBy adding a color value to the border-radius property

By adding a color value to the border property.

lessons.title: Example 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add a border to the h3 rule.

Make sure to pick border.

lessons.title: Example 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add a border to all paragraphs by typing border: solid 50px;.

Make sure to type border: solid 50px;.

executableContent.instructions:
Add a solid border to all `a` elements. Set it to something like `5px` and any color.

Use AI if you don't remember the exact syntax.

files.name: index.html
files.content: Link 1 Link 2 Link 3 Link 4

executableContent.instructions: Now, add a `border-radius` property and set it to any number of pixels you want.

files.name: index.html
files.content: Link 1 Link 2 Link 3 Link 4

lessons.title: Margin
lessons.interactiveContent: Margins generate space around an element, outside of any paddings and borders.

lessons.title: Left margin
lessons.interactiveContent:
To change the margin on the left side of an element, we use the margin-left property.

Make sure to pick margin-left: 50px;.

lessons.title: Right margin
lessons.interactiveContent:
To change the margin on the right side of an element, we use the margin-right property.

Make sure to pick margin-right: 50px;.

lessons.title: Top and bottom
lessons.interactiveContent:
The same goes for margin-top and margin-bottom.

Make sure to pick margin, followed by margin.

lessons.title: Margin property
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which property do you think changes the margin on all sides at once?

Make sure to pick margin.

lessons.title: Padding and margin
lessons.interactiveContent:
Although they both add spacing around them, margins and paddings are different.

The padding adds space between the content and the border, while the margin adds space between the border and other elements.

lessons.title: Question 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What are margins?

The space around an element, outside of any paddings and bordersThe space between the content and the border of an element

The space around an element, outside of any paddings and borders.

lessons.title: Question 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of these changes the margins on all four sides of an element?

marginmargin-full

Make sure to pick margin.

lessons.title: Question 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's the difference between paddings and margins?

Paddings are inside while margins are outside of any bordersPaddings are outside while margins are inside of any borders

Paddings are inside while margins are outside of any borders.

executableContent.instructions: Add margins to all sides of the `p` element by using only one property.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Why do programmers prefer dark mode?

Because light attracts bugs.
